lines.text: Here is recorded a stark episode in the lives of a stern, unforgiving people, a story of bigotry uncurbed and its train of sorrow, shame and tragedy...
Control thy wanton nose, Master Giles!
Hester Prynne, thou hast profaned God's holy day! Take heed, therefore! If ye sin, ye must pay - there is no escape!
It would be pleasant, sir, to walk beside thee and hear thee condemn me for my sins.
I have told thee my thoughts - thou dost say they are sinful - but, why? Why are we taught to be ashamed - of love?
My mother picked me from a rosebush.
Breathe it not to a soul - the Governor is an old nincompoop! - and the Beadle is a parrot in petticoats!
On the morrow - Election Day - the one day in the Puritans' year when gaiety was not an offense.
I am wrongly accused! Never hath my tongue been given to gossip!
Falsehood! Her tongue hath wagged like the tail of a dog! Duck her again!
